Experiment Method.Assay Method: 2 - D difference in - gel electrophoresis (2D - DIGE)

Material used.Description: Mitochondria were purified from differentiated SH - SY5Y cells overexpressing WT or A53T R - syn and control cells.

Readout description.Result Description: Of the protein spots found to be differentially expressed (nâ‰¥71; p < 0.01, >1.8/<-1.8 fold change), 63 proteins were identified by LC - MS/MS, with the majority (77%) significantly altered in WT samples only.

Biological replicates.Description: 4 replicates each of control, A53T and WT groups in the pH 4 - 7 range and 3 replicates from each of the same three groups in the pH 6 - 11 range.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA was carried out across all groups (host, WT, A53T) with a threshold of p < 0.01 and fold change (<-1.8 or >1.8), and further statistical investigation of the ANOVA significant protein spots was carried out using independent t - tests (host versus WT, host versus A53T).

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Protein spots with p < 0.01 and fold change (<-1.8 or >1.8) were considered significantly differentially expressed.

Material used.Description: Whole cell lysate and mitochondrial extracts were prepared from differentiated SH - SY5Y cells.

Readout description.Result Description: Altered levels of four mitochondrial proteins (HSPA9 (mortalin), NDUFS1, DLAT, ATP5A1) were confirmed. The levels of WT R - syn and A53T R - syn expression were approximately equal in the permanently transfected SH - SY5Y cell lines and significantly higher than in the host cells.

Biological replicates.Description: For Western blots run for the purposes of validation, three consecutive passages of cell extracts were run in parallel for each sample type.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample type was run in duplicate.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Bands were analyzed using Quantity One image analysis software, and the bands were normalized against background staining and the mean total protein stain for each sample lane. Optical density values were calculated as a percentage of the mean signal generated by control cells.

Experiment Method.Assay Method: OXPHOS Complex I Quantity and Activity Analysis

Material used.Description: Mitochondria were prepared from triplicate passages of each cell type.

Readout description.Result Description: A significant reduction in OXPHOS 1 activity was observed in the WT R - syn cells.

Biological replicates.Description: Mitochondria were prepared from triplicate passages of each cell type.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Independent t - tests were used to determine statistical significance (threshold at p < 0.05).
